page.title: 19LIVE AID the Global Jukebox
page.content: For the first time in history there was to be a major world-wide pop concert. This was the dream of 'Boomtown Rat',{Bob Geldorf,}who with {Midge Ure}of Ultravox, masterminded the 1984 Christmas number one hit{Let {them know it's Christmas.}All profits from this smash hit went to help starving people in Ethiopia. It was known as the Band Aid record, and everyone involved in its production gave their services for nothing. One summer day in 1985 Live Aid happened all over the world, but especially in the{Wembley Stadium, {London}and the{J.F.K. Stadium, {Philadelphia.}Nearly every famous pop star took part. It was a magical day which we will never forget. The happy feeling, the music of hopefulness, circled the planet. Over forty million pounds have been raised so far.
